text: Very nice people! My husband & son (son who has allergies) loved the Brownie cake. I bought for husbands b-day, so my son could have chocolate cake. I am not having sugar right now, however, I did try a tiny piece. I thought it was perfect.  I will come back again, regardless of the longggg drive from where I live. Excellent customer service. Looking forward to trying many other treats from this bakery, eventually.

Gluten Zero is absolutely amazing! Clarissa and the whole staff were so helpful with our experience. The way she takes her time to talk to you and give you a rundown on the bakery, the ingredients of what you're buying, and her story is absolutely incredible. If you're looking for a bakery that's completely gluten free this is the place to go!

They catered my wedding and did an amazing job. We had cake and cupcakes, all were delicious and a huge hit with my guests. Many of them didn't even know they were gluten free and were surprised by the quality because usually gluten free stuff tastes like dust. Is this stuff healthy? No, its cake. If you're on a diet go eat kale, if you want cookies and other sweet stuff go to GlutenZero.

I went into GlutenZero bakery on Sun 11/08/15 and got their bread, the bread falls apart so I couldnot make sandwiches which I wanted so bad, next it had a slight sour dough taste along with another really bitter taste, called owner on Tue she said the bread does fall apart sometimes but did not know why. she said she was going to bake more bread the next day (wed) and she would call me for another loaf, I made sure she had my number, but ALAS today is Friday and I have not heard from her, BAD BUSINESS,, i guess she doesnot care for her customers,,,will not go back again,,poor customer service
Great delicious desserts!!! It's a must visit... The owners is so nice and informative.... Please visit!!! Clarissa is a wonderful person

This is my favorite bakery in Las Vegas. I've never found any remotely good gluten free(and vegan) pastries before. They taste just like regular cupcakes and cookies. The service is always great, and very accommodating. I especially recommend the gluten free and vegan carrot cake cupcakes.

Absolutely amazing! I've tried everything of hers and shes always so sweet and friendly. She has so many options not only for GF people but even vegan. She goes beyond GF and really cares. If you're ever in town this is the place to go. Everything I've tried has actually been better, more moist, and more rich than regular bakeries that have wheat cupcakes. If you're Celiac or not, or not really sure what Gluten Free means, just go try this place you won't regret it.

Being gluten free is getting easier, and tastier! With GF shops and bakerys popping up everywhere it's hard to know which ones are good. Well Gluten Zero is amazing!! I went to Las Vagas to get married and needed a cake (GF of course) I searched online and called Gluten Zero and they were happy to take my order and have my cake ready for me when i showed up.
Enough technical talk, the cake was AMAZING!!! I ordered a carrot cake. You never really know what GF foods are going to taste like, but it tasted like my Mom's recipe!! 
I will definitely tell everyone i can about them, and of course get more tasty treats!!
Lovely couple and delicious gluten free desserts! It's so nice to see this business doing well. Recommended whether you're gluten intolerant or not!
These cupcakes are AMAZING! A dedicated GF Bakery! My new safe place for  sweets. The owner Chris she is also amazing, very passionate about her product

This bakery is AWESOME! Being a celiac, I've struggled to find delicious recipes or store bought products to fill my sweet tooth. Upon entering the store, I was greeted by Cris (the owner) who engaged in great conversation and was more than willing to share her knowledge on gluten-containing products! The treats are absolutely delicious, she has a great selection of sweets and is always baking something fresh! My experience was fantastic and I can't wait to go back!

First time here yesterday and couldn't be more excited about it! I had a last-minute custom cake order which Chris was happy to accommodate and turned it around in a few hours on a Friday afternoon! Staff could not have been nicer and quality/taste is absolutely amazing! Definitely our new go to gluten-free bakery!!

I went in there tonight with a cake emergency. My daughter and I are VERY gluten sensitive. It was my daughter's b-day and I didn't have enough time to make her cake. I went in there hoping to pick up something for the family. They happened to have an un-iced cake they were experimenting on. The owners got it together for me and I took it home. At first my daughter said it looked good, but it was too bad we couldn't eat it. I told her where I got it and that it was gluten free.  My daughter loved it! She was so excited. Even the gluten eaters in the family said it tasted good. (I don't hear that often) I am even extra sensitive to other ingredients as well as just gluten, and I didn't even get sick! It was a good night! Thank you.

We were visiting the area, and I stopped in here on my way out of town after noticing their sign the day before.  I'm gluten intolerant, so I am constantly looking for innovators in this area.  They did not disappoint.

I tried two different flavors of cookies and picked up a loaf of bread fresh from the oven.  The flavor of the bread is strikingly close to any yeast-based, raised loaf (very good).  They had brownies and other baked goods available as well.

The owner, Cris, is constantly refining her recipes and we're the lucky beneficiaries.  I got to "talk shop" with her for a few minutes, and her family have themselves been dealing with extreme gluten allergies (Celiac) for many years.  Thus, she's got the experience on what needs to be considered in prep and ingredients.  Customers should be able to relax and know you're in good hands with someone that isn't just doing this because "gluten-free" is something of a fad in some circles.

I have a feeling GlutenZero Bakery just getting started with her offerings, and they're going to be something over time.  I will, definitely, go back.

We ordered a gluten-free carrot cake from GlutenZero Bakery for an anniversary party. Several of our guests cannot eat gluten because of serious health conditions (i.e., celiac disease, autoimmune liver disease). We wanted them to feel included in the festivities. Here's the verdict from one of them: "The cake was excellent ... the best I've ever tasted and everyone who tried it loved it. Thanks for providing the option." 

The cake was affordable and pretty, too, in our purple-and-orange color theme. Thank you GlutenZero for making it so easy for us to make our guests happy!

If you chance to frequent when something has been freshly made you are in luck and it will probably be good even. However, it seems as though often what is available is 2-3 days old. This is the difference between the 4 star and low star reviews. I have experienced both good and bad baked goods myself. At my friends house for the holidays, she had ordered pies in advance.The quality was nowhere anything close to the miniature versions she has brought me before. It doesn't seem they have the ability to keep all fresh items out each day or that they can maintain high quality standards at busy times such as the holidays. Wish they were reliable and consistent but you never know what you're getting unfortunately and for the price that you have to pay for expensive gluten free goods it's too costly to hope it's good when you happen to walk in.

So gluten free has never been a favorite, especially when it comes to those whom enjoy a gluten rich diet. However, this bakery is delicious!  Had the blue berry pie and it may not fill the requirements of a gluten rich diet but it does satisfy the taste buds!! Plus the owner is adorable and informative!! Thank you for a wonderful (guilt free) gluten zeros dessert!!

Today I was surprised to find this gem. They have not been open very long but I am pleased to say everything I tasted today was wonderful. I am extremely pleased with the items I purchased. If you eat gluten free bread you know that the texture and taste are not the same. Well I bought a loaf of fresh bread and have already eaten three large slices. That speaks for itself on how much I love it.  Thank you for this wonderful gift!!!! I also bought the carrot cake and have eaten a small slice......absolutely wonderful but my favorite was the chocolate cupcake. The service was wonderful and they get it what it means to be gluten free. I thank you from the bottom of my heart. I will be coming here a lot!!!!!

All I can say is YUMMMMMMM

Oh, and THANK YOU! I love your goodies and I will be back! Please stick around!

We joined my husband for a business trip to Vegas, which happened to also be on my birthday. I ordered a carrot cake from Gluten Zero bakery and it was delicious!!  The price was awesome as well!  I will definitely visit again, next time we go to Vegas. 

Be sure to call a few days in advance to place your order!

I have an intolerance to gluten, so eating too much gluten will give me headaches and nausea so I began a search for yummy gluten free desserts. This proved to be difficult as I'm fairly picky when it comes to my cookies and milk. My parents found this bakery and decided to bring some home. I was pretty excited. I took a bite of some cookies when I got home and then some cupcakes and they are the best bites of gluten free pastries that I have ever tried! All the gluten free products that I have tried tend to be crumbly, these however are not nearly as bad and they are super tasty. Even my father agreed and he is picker than me! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone whether you have to eat gluten free or not. I will definitely be going back for more! I am so surprised and pleased by this bakery!!!

Being a vegan it is really hars to get great deserts.

I found this place and was so excited. That was short lived.

They only had 3 itwms available.. Cherry pie , Apple Pie and Lemon cookies.. So I ordered one of each.

The cherry pie tasted like they just dumped a pound of sugar in the cherry pie, all I could taste was sugar granules. The Apple oie was a littlw better, but barly and I didn't even.try the cookies. They had a bunch of stuff I had NEVER heard of. My 13 year old did amd said they where not that good.

VERY DISAPPOINTED. NOT allot of stuff like advertised. And ehat they did have was horrible.

Sorry guys , I tried.

Never new I was allergic to Gluten until I tried this place.  Not only are they delicious they are also educational.  When I spoke to the owner he told me how his family has gone thru terrible experiences with Gluten.  In addition he gave me advice on different books to read about Gluten.
Very nice couple who run the place. I got the chocolate chip cookie so yummy. It's always nice to meet other celiacs so you can talk about places to eat.

I just bought chocolate chip cookies, a blackberry mini pie, a cinnamon role, and a carrot cake cupcake here about three hours ago...idk if any of them will love to see the light of tomorrow because they are some of the best gf treats I've EVER had. And I live in NYC and LA, both part time. I've had allllll the trendy gf treats. This place is amazing. I hope the business is blessed with an increased customer base so they are able to grow and get their products to more people. Seriously, seriously delicious. YUM.

Full disclosure: I don't have celiac disease and I don't keep a GF diet. That said, I have friends and coworkers who do, and I have checked out a lot of GF bakeries and products when buying them gifts or bringing treats to the office. GlutenZero is not my first choice.

I expect higher prices for GF goods versus regular bakeries, but these prices are pretty steep and I have yet to be impressed by anything I've tried. My boss graciously accepted one of their bread loaves, but as she brought her sandwiches to work all week, they fell apart. The bread just doesn't hold up. I've grabbed some muffins and cupcakes and haven't really cared for them.

The location is good and gets a lot of traffic, and they clearly have an in-demand product, and their staff is friendly and helpful when I go in... but the location is bare with minimal decor, more like a wholesale shop than a specialty bakery, and the goods just aren't that good.

Ordered a red velvet cake for my kid. 
It was so good 
Love this place.
I normally get the chocolate chip cookies and this was the first time getting a cake.
This was the best gluten freee I've had and will be back whenever I visit Vegas!
Haven't tried the food there but waited for the place to open and they are not open at the time they advertise....

GlutenZero Bakery's doors are open for business! For now it's soft opening. The current offerings are a variety of gluten free cupcakes. I was seriously blown away at how rich and chocolatey the brownie truffle sampling that owner Clarissa offered me. She created tasty GF treats without compromising the texture and taste. So good that everyone can enjoy these!  Without any hesitation I paid $4.99 for  Brownie Truffle cupcake with pecans. Size wise, larger than a cupcake. So worth the price.

The bakery/kitchen prep area is a gluten free zone. For those you who are gluten sensitive or diagnosed with Celiac Disease, I know you'll appreciate this. You don't have to be worried about cross contamination since this place specializes in gluten free baked goods. 

I can't to try Clarissa's trademark bread SafeBread. According to their website it's  a bread that is for safe Celiacs, Diabetics Autistics and Vegans. For now though, there are two cold case displays filled with just the cupcakes. Grand opening targeted for June 6th, with ribbon cutting festivities from 5-7pm 

NOTE: This Yelp listing name is formatted wrong.  It's GlutenZero. Just like their storefront sign and how their business cards read. Correction for name and address change has been submitted,

Location and Hours: your visual cue from Eastern Ave is Twin Peaks restaurant directly behind it, right by Crepe Expectations. The store hours fluctuate. For now bakery will stay open till 7pm to accommodate those coming down after gym class. Sweet!

That place rocks! Great place. 100% gluten free. I asked to make me a birthday groovy cake and they did.... not only that it was gluten free it was vegan as well according to my request. And it tasted bomb.com . It was sooooo good. And the next morning this cake with coffee was aaaaaaamazing. Love the energy of this place. They are very friendly and healthy. Love that! Definitely coming back.

We stumbled across this place while out driving, and decided to sample a few of the items. Everything we got was yummy, with just the right amount of sweetness. Yummy tummies all around, and we will definitely be back!

He came today with gluten free cheesecake, carrot cake, brownies, German chocolate cake, and some chocolate cake concoction. All look amazing. He wanted to keep me happy during the basketball game and make sure I had plenty to pick from!

If you have Celiac like myself it's genuinely hard to trust anywhere. Trust away here!!! I LOVE their lemon cupcake and their chocolate chip cookies are absolutely delicious and stay moist for days! I live on the opposite side of town but going the distance for their delicious sweet treats are well worth it. The owner is also an absolute doll and has tons of experience and knowledge in the field she's in.

Nummy!
Gluten free and vegan options. Try the Blackberry pie. I'm going back for the pecan pie next week!

Our Treats were amazing, some of the best gluten free cupcakes we ever had!  The owner was very nice as well, check out all her amazing artwork around the shop. It's pretty awesome! Can't wait to go back!

I have been to this bakery twice. The first time both cupcakes we purchased were extremely dry and bland. I thought I would try it one more time. This time I got a cupcake and a cinnamon roll. They are both extremely dry and have no flavor. I couldn't even finish the cinnamon roll because it was so dry. I've had other gluten free bakery items where I could not even tell the difference. This place is definitely not one of them. Won't be going back.
OMG her stuff is so good. I got a cherry pie and lemon curd cupcake. Best GF sweets I have ever had. She really cares about the safety of your health. Highly recommend.
It doesn't even matter if your not on a gluten free diet: you must try this place. The carrot cake is the food of the god's here!!!
The owner has no contacted us and apologized for the inconvenience which means everything because customer service is everything. We appreciate you trying and taking the time to reach out again.

I stopped by this place and was greeted with a sample. It was carrot cake and it was so good that I got 4 cupcakes. All of them were delicious, and not just good for gluten free, really good for any cupcake. Shop owner was friendly too. Highly recommend.

Got my mama an early Mother's Day present yesterday. After lunch I went to Gluton Zero Bakery in the same plaza on eastern. My mom has the allergy and has been really good about eating treats lately, but I know she has a soft spot for the chocolate. So I got a brownie truffle cupcake and a chocolate cheesecake with mousse! She had the cheesecake last night and said it was awesome!!
My wife bakes better than this all gluten free. Chewy, dense, no lemon flavor on lemon cup cakes. Poor.

I love the lemon curd and the carrot cake, I missed the cinnamon buns last time, but they are on my list to try. Everything so far was delicious! I live nearby and find it hard to resist getting a snack every day.

The lemon curd cupcake is so good, but a friend and I had a very offending visit here. We came in to give a local small business some love like we have in the past and the lady kept saying very offensive things to my friend. We were on break and I was styling her hair and we came in and the lady working made these remarks on the lines of ... omg I know it took you 4hrs to do THAT hair (were African Americans so our hair is extra curly) then I told her no only 30 mins then she went on to say you have talent to do THAT type of hair and actually it doesn't because black hair is the same as anyone else's hair. If you don't have anything nice to say or know how to say it then don't say it AT ALL! It was a uncomfortable setting and for that I will take my business else where. It's 2017 we don't have to be offensive towards one another.

I tried the carrot cake cupcake and the german chocolate cupcake, and both were incredibly delicious. My boyfriend does not react well to gluten, so these were for his birthday, and he loved his carrot cupcake. My birthday is this month, and will definitely be getting my birthday dessert from here!
Lemon curd cupcakes are super delicious! The cupcake was moist and the curd was fresh and lemony tasting. The frosting on top was light and sweet and went perfectly with the lemon curd.

I got a carrot cake muffin, and the lemon cookies. I also got a couple of their gluten free pizzas. Be aware that they use oat flour and that is not good for many celiacs.

The carrot cake muffin and lemon cookies were tasty but the pizza was not very good at all. Specifically the crust just doesn't taste good. Maybe they are still working on it.

The wife is happy we came here tonight. She is on a dairy and egg free diet right now and usually can't have sweets because of eggs and milk being in most baked goods. She enjoyed a vegan carrot cupcake tonight and loved it. I enjoyed a lemon cream tort with my daughter that is not vegan. This place is amazing! If you have gluten sensitivity or celiac disease, you should check out this bakery! The best part is that everyone will love these baked goods whether they have issues with gluten or not.
I loved my carrot cake Bday cake. I highly recommend this place. You don't have to be gluten free to enjoy these amazing desserts.. Just ask my boyfriend who ate most of my cake. He was impressed.

Very good concept. Love that this establishment literally has zero gluten. The owner is very sweet, and very informative. If your looking for sweet treats that are 100% gluten free this is the place to go.

Really appreciate a gluten free bakery with a good variety of products. Cupcakes weren't my favorite though. And the cinnamon rolls were a little dry and have a tough texture. But replicating a regular cinnamon roll isn't easy.

Love being a tourist in Vegas, from Seattle, Wa (where we have a ton of gf options) and finding a yummy gf bakery! The chocolate chip/oatmeal cookies and mini apple pie were delicious!!! 
Thank you!! :) ~Seattle

I was so excited to try this bakery after having my eye on it in my bookmarks for a while! I went in on a Wednesday early afternoon my way back to Salt Lake City and stopped to grab some treats for my long trek.

The store itself is huge and it is mostly made up of the bakery but you won't feel awkward coming into order things. The gentleman working greeted me as soon as I walked in. He was in the middle of prepping a bread to make. I asked him questions regarding what of the items were dairy free while still being gluten free. He told me about the cupcakes that were and then walked me over to the other counter area near the cash register that cased dairy free cinnamon roles.

The cinnamon roles looked AMAZING-- I was so tempted to try them but settled for one chocolate cupcake, and a carrot cake cupcake. The cupcake size is bigger than your average cupcake which I appreciated and the price was $7.98 for 2, making each of them only around $4 each, not bad! (Size wise each cupcake is realistically the size of two regular cupcakes or around 4 mini cupcakes.)

Everything is cased in refrigeration so you don't have to worry about them melting right away on your way home. He cased each cupcake individually and I tried one of them right away but liked them better when they had set to more of a room temperature. They were a little dry and crumbly but the flavor was good and the frosting was great!

I bake myself and while I never mean to be critical, I know that gluten free baking is one tough beast to conquer. Not to mention dairy free as well. I've had to mess around with different recipes to get texture just right on a lot of my baked items so I assume the moisture isn't an issue with the regular gluten free items but I can't say for sure. Either way it's a delicious treat that you couldn't have before that you get to enjoy!

While checking out the gentleman gave me their card and said to call them if I ever need a cake for anything. I'm guessing this is their biggest specialty, definitely considering the size of the space as well as being a specialty bakery that is probably where most their orders come from.

It was awfully quiet when I went in, and because I was the only one in there I feel like it seemed even more so. It wouldn't hurt to have some low key music or the radio on, just a thought to add some mood pleasing ambiance!
Great place I came in to see what it was I thought maybe they will taste bad I got both kind brownies cupcakes they r great my husband loved them

I purchased two brownies, carrot cake and cookies - amazing! Even my super picky spouse loved these delights. We got these for our daughter who is sensitive to gluten. We just happened to spot this place as we drove by and decided to stop check it out. So glad we did. Looking forward to returning soon.

Everything is 100% gluten free, so people who need to adhere to a strict gf diet can enjoy without worry!  I sampled a little of many of the gf items that were available at the time (I went on a weekday right before closing, so they probably have more during peak hours).  These included the carrot cake, lemon cake, brownie, and chocolate cake, but it was the raspberry tort that "took the cake"!  I still fantasize about that raspberry tort, and need to make a trip to see them again :-)   Also, the owners are a super-nice husband and wife team, with the wife being the primary food artist. She was caring enough to personally return a phone call on her day off, no less, and do her best to answer my questions about the ingredients she uses, and told me that her recipes are an evolving process (a true gluten-free baker!)   I will be back.
I live in Lake Havasu City and I would travel to Vegas just for this place!!! So yummy!!! Best gluten free desserts I have found!! The owner was very nice and friendly!

I tried the carrot cake and brownie.  I will keep coming back.  They're dangerous!  I thought the carrot cake frosting was a bit too sweet for me (thats just me coz I find most things are), I still want more.  The brownie I had to begrudgingly share with my kids for a small taste.  My 9-yo son said, "Oh I want gluten free now!"  I'm not allergic to wheat, but to rye.  I'm at a phase where I'm testing if I should eliminate wheat too cause somebody told me that a big percent of wheat is tainted with rye.

We are on vacation from San Diego and happened upon this gluten free bakery. My 10 year old son is gluten free but let's be honest, we can all benefit. We ordered lemon curd and a chocolate truffle cupcakes. I love anything lemon so I couldn't wait to take a bite of this tasty treat and it was delicious! As for the chocolate truffle...a family favorite. My husband said you'd never know it's gluten free. We'll be making another stop today after 1:00 when the fresh bread is ready. I highly recommend supporting this local business because Cris, the owner understands challenges faced by those who eat GF.

I stopped in on my way out of town and bought a few brownies, a loaf of bread that smelled amazing right out of the oven, a raspberry tort and some chocolate chip cookies.  Seriously some of the best baked goods I've ever eaten!  Excellent customer service and my only complaint is that it's a few hours away from me in Arizona!
Drove from the west of the valley, arrived at 10:00 am.  Hung around until 10:10 and it was still closed.  Not worth the trip.

I try hard to support businesses with gluten free options, but I found this place expensive and hard to justify the effort it took me to get there. I bought 4 carrot cake muffins/cupcakes and one loaf of bread, and spent $20 if you count the small tip I left. The GF loaf of bread I took home was very dry. It crumbled under the pressure of my hands when I made a sandwich with it. The carrot cake muffins were tasty, albeit a little sweet. 

To the owners, if you're looking to other bakeries with other GF models and are ever in the SF area, please check out BioCafe in downtown San Francisco near Union Sq. They are my idea of a GF done right. Thank you and I hope you guys stay in business.

The staff is very kind and the lemon curd cupcake was delicious. Although more of a lemon bar texture, it was still flavorful and something I'd enjoy again. 

I do wish however that there was more of a selection and that the bakery cases in the front were pretty and filled with goodies when you walk in the doors.
This place is fantastic, the owners are so passionate, I will keep coming back here guaranteed.

Amazing service, I could not find a gluten free bakery that made red velvet cakes until I found GlutenZero. The owner is fabulous, she called me to confirm details and asked if she could put her special touch on the cake and all I can say is wow! Beautiful cake and I could not resist getting her lemon and carrot cake cupcakes! Excited to eat all these yummy treats! Thank you for your outstanding service!

My son and I both have celiac disease it's so amazing at this place is completely gluten free facility plus the people there are so amazing and nice :-) it helps that the food is delicious :-) the lemon curd cupcake is my son's favorite but I like the carrot cake heated in the microwave for a few seconds it tastes just like a Cinnabon :-) except without all that nasty gluten lol :-)

Stopped in on a whim this morning, not ever hearing about this bakery before. My mom was recently diagnosed with a gluten, dairy and egg allergy so I wanted to get her a treat. As soon as we stepped in, the woman who owns the shop was so friendly and lovely to us. She chatted with me about gluten allergy and gave me some great information. BUT THE BEST PART, the chocolate cupcake brownies were delicious and I was told by a friend that she loved the cookies as well! Absolutely wonderful, we will be back!

After practically dying from delight upon tasting the brownies, my boyfriend and I had to return the very next day for more. I would highly recommend those as well as the oatmeal chocolate chip cookies and cinnamon rolls.

Best Bakery ever! Cupcakes and pizza are DELICIOUS! Vegan options available!! A must go for people with celiac disease or you just want to try gluten free. They have gluten free bread and a really tasty jalapeño cheddar bread. They know exactly what they're doing and are very helpful. A variety of pies are Lo's billable to order !! Can't recommend this place enough

I really love this place.  Not only was the owner great, but she was friendly and offered us free samples.  I ordered the lemon tart and chocolate chip cookie and seriously could not tell the difference, it was actually better than the regular desserts. The lemon dessert was smooth and flavorful.  Will be going back to try one of everything!

Delicious gluten-free goodies! Wonderfully surprised how good everything was! So far I have tried the Carrot Cake Cupcake & Lemon; both are amazing. The Lemon Cake tasted just like my Nana used to make. Very satisfied with this bakery! Stop by & try some samples, truly amazing :) Shop owner is also very friendly and knowledgeable about a gluten diet :)

This is a Gluten Free Bakery, however it is NOT SUGAR FREE...The items are made with care, however everything made with C&H Sugar, so if you are diabetic, or watching your sugar levels, this is not the place for you.

We decided to stop in and bought a brownie truffle with nuts.  I took it home and could only take two bites and started to get a headache from all the sugar.  The taste is good don't get me wrong, the ideas are great, the creations are amazing, but as of right now there is nothing sugar-free.  

This is a soft opening for this place the official Grand Opening will be in early June so maybe as they get things going better, they will look at using something other then pure cane sugar or even try making some items sugar-free.

The stuff here is good, there were only a few selections available but like I said, be careful because Gluten Free does not necessarily mean healthy, you will still pack on the pounds with all the sugar in the items they currently have.  Unless we see a change, this is a place we will not be back because sugar, especially at the content level in their products is not something we can tolerate.

I say you still should give them a try and leave your own comments.  I am just one person who cares about sugar content, there are many that may think this place is Heaven, I just cannot eat what they serve as it will put me there and I am not ready to go yet.

I love visiting bakeries, and buying something new to try. I am not gluten intolerant, so I was curious to what they had to offer. All there baked goods looked amazing, but I was still full from lunch. So I decided to try the chocolate chip cookies. I was amazed on the size and the price. I love the flavor and texture of the cookie. I will definitely come back and try more of the desserts.

Amazing flavor and moist texture.. you must try the lemon it is very refreshing. I would definitely recommend this bakery to friends and family and the owner is very knowledgeable about gluten free allergy.

On entering, I was immediately greeted by an employee as I perused a display case containing 2 trays of miniature carrot cakes.  I then checked for other pastries, but was disappointed to find trays with only 1 or 2 pastries so I ended up purchasing 2 carrot cakes, one with and one without walnuts.  We shared one later that evening and the other the night following, but the cakes were much too dry though the cream cheese frosting was good.

Amazing bakery!
Very informed, friendly staff.
Great variety of pastries, cookies, cakes, cupcakes, and more!!!
The lemon and raspberry curd cupcakes were delicious. As were the chocolate cupcake and chocolate vegan cookies!!!!
We will be regulars
My fiancé and I decided to try this place out and were very impressed by their gluten free choices. We tried the truffle brownie cupcake and we loved it! We will be going back for sure.

Chris, the lady who owns this place has celiac so it really gives me a feeling of safety in believing that the goods here are really gluten free.  As she personally explained to us, its gluten ZERO because there is actually a ton of additives and other products that have hidden glutens and none of her products has any of those.  I found her talk very educational and it was very useful.  I often write reviews comparing gluten free goods to other gluten free goods since there is a stigma that gluten free goods are generally not as good, but the chocolate chip cookies here are SO good compared to ANY baked goods, gluten free, gluten zero, or with gluten.  I love them.  They are a little crunchy but also soft and chewy in the middle and they have this nice taste to them and the chocolate has that ooey gooey feel.  So good.
There are some other items available but the other things we had were the lemon meringue cupcake, the carrot cake cupcake, and the brownie cupcake.  My friend really liked the brown cupcake who picked that, my other friend like the lemon meringue since that's his flavor.  I personally don't like those flavors so for me personally the brownie cupcake was too sweet and chocolatey, the lemon was too tangy and sweet.  But the people they were meant for loved them.  The carrot cake was a little dry and Chris told me to heat them up in the microwave and that would probably have solved the problem but I don't have a microwave, so I didn't get to experience it the way it was meant to be experience.
Super nice lady who is also a great artist and tasty gluten zero eats.  Love it!  Thanks!

Nice to know there is a good option for GF vegan treats that I don't have to make myself! My carrot cake was a little sweet, but it was DELICIOUS! And Cris is super nice and knowledgeable! 

I'll totally go back!

Items Selected:
Samples - Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting, Black Forest Cake, BBQ Sauce.
Cinnamon Roll
Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting and Walnuts
Brownie and Truffle Icing with Pecans
Lemon Curd Vanilla Cupcake

Not exactly involved in the diagnosis or management of Celiac Disease, but watching the trend of 'gluten free' everything take place from the perspective of a physician charged with assigning treatment to other autoimmune related conditions it was actually at the recommendation of a patient afflicted with both Hashimoto's Thyroiditis and biopsy-proven Celiac that a stop at GlutenZero Bakery off Eastern Avenue was planned, owner Clarissa and her son each busy preparing the days goods but delightful and forthcoming just the same.

In part a work of passion but also one of self preservation, the owner and her daughter each suffering symptoms for years before their own diagnoses, GlutenZero is a certified gluten free space in a repurposed former gym and admitting a great deal of expense invested in opening the place without yet catching on with the community at large it was with several samples shared that Clarissa discussed her process and practice, everything made in house with top-tier ingredients and even the Lichtenstein-leaning paintings on the wall produced by her hands.

Almost as expansive in selections as the space itself is in size, the front chiller filled with several styles of carrot cake while the rest are encased in glass near the baking area in back, it was first in a small spoonful of fresh, fruity Barbeque sauce that opinions began to form and although the German Chocolate was a bit more dense than some may prefer the flavor spot-on, the same to be said of a citrusy lemon curd cupcake stuffed with stiffly whipped cream that thankfully trended far more light.

Unable to pass up cinnamon rolls that were being glazed fresh from the oven before my very eyes, suffice it to say that unlike the springy curls of Glutton or The Bagel Cafe the version at GlutenZero eats more like a yeasty poundcake not-so-different than Cinnabon, though a touch more toothsome and far less buttery in taste.

Modesty impressed to this point, though still not wowed, it was next into the carrot cake that fork-and-knife were plunged, the first bite flooding the palate with sweetness and spice while subsequent tastes revealed textural variance amidst a substantial amount of moistness, the frosting tangy with cream cheese beneath a light dusting of ground nuts.

Told by both the owner and my patient that the chocolate truffle brownie was perhaps the best in town it was admittedly with skepticism that such a claim was assessed, but setting aside all prejudices related to rumors and dietary restrictions it would honestly be difficult to name any as decadent, both the flourless chocolate base and creamy ball atop it on par with plated desserts at restaurants despite far less expense.

****Doing very impressive things within the strict limitations of an entirely gluten free space one can only hope that there is a large enough audience to support GlutenZero Bakery through the early opening phases, I know I'll be back sometime soon to check out the pies and give the brownie another taste.
Beside a fantastic cookie and blueberry pie. The old gentleman seemed a little bothered when asked for them. Maybe some better customer service.

I was visiting from Washington state this weekend and was extremely excited when I found out about this bakery. The selection wasn't the greatest when we went and the owner said it was because they got 2 last minute cake orders and had to focus on those. 
We ended up leaving with a carrot cake cupcake with cream cheese icing, a brownie cupcake with truffle icing, a cinnamon roll, and 2 bags of chocolate chocolate chip cookies.
I was beyond excited to get home to try everything. 3 of us huddled around the counter and cut into the cinnamon roll first. We heated it up like the owner told us to and it was unbelievably dry. It was severely lacking in salt and had no taste. Even the cinnamon was barely there. It was bizarre. Parts of the roll were rock hard and others were so dry that they crumbled. 
Next we tried the carrot cake cupcake. The cream cheese frosting had too much butter in it so it tasted more like buttercream than cream cheese frosting. There was almost no cream cheese taste at all. The cake itself was very dry and was also lacking in salt. The cake was so dry that when we cut it up to taste it, parts of it fell apart completely to sandy little bits. 
We decided to tackle the brownie cupcake next. This one had more moisture to it, but just a small amount. It was still dry and lacked salt. I did like the truffle topping quite a bit. It was smooth and creamy and had a good chocolaty taste. It fell apart when we cut it, but wasn't as bad as the carrot cake. 
Finally we ate the cookies. Immediately I noticed that they were very spread out like they were over mixed or had too much baking soda in them. With the first bite I knew that it was too much baking soda. The outside of the cookie was very hard and the middle was softer, more like a good cookie should be. There wasn't much chocolate taste and the bite of baking soda took over everything else. We had given a bag of cookies to my sister and her husband and they didn't like them either. 
Overall, the bakery was a disappointment. For gluten free stuff the price of everything was actually pretty decent. But, the taste was just not good. Hopefully they can work on their recipes and this place can become great. But, right now its not a place I would ever go again.

We've been to this bakery a bunch of times now. We always stop in and stock up on gluten free treats when we're in the area. We've had the double chocolate cookies, lemon curd cupcakes, carrot cake, jalapeño cheddar bread, and a plain bread.  They have a pretty wide menu overall but don't have everything every day. When we pop in we just see what's available. Taste and texture can vary a little from batch to batch, I do wish there was more consistency. That said we love having access to a dedicated gluten free bakery that makes great tasting product
